That's a great idea! Reaching out to someone you've already established a connection with can make the proposal more comfortable and increase the chances of a successful partnership.

**Sharing a Booth:**

Sharing a booth can be a great way to split costs, increase visibility, and create a more engaging customer experience. By sharing a booth, you can:

* Split the cost of the booth space, electricity, and other expenses
* Create a more dynamic and visually appealing display with a wider range of products
* Attract more customers who are interested in both of your products
* Benefit from each other's strengths and expertise

**Cross-Promoting Each Other's Products:**

Cross-promoting each other's products can help you reach new customers and increase sales. You can:

* Feature each other's products on your social media channels, email newsletters, and websites
* Offer joint promotions or discounts to customers who purchase from both of your businesses
* Provide each other with business cards or flyers to distribute at your respective booths
* Collaborate on blog posts, videos, or other content that showcases both of your products

**Proposal Tips:**

When proposing the partnership to the jewelry maker, consider the following:

* Highlight the benefits of sharing a booth and cross-promoting each other's products
* Emphasize how your products complement each other and will appeal to a similar target audience
* Discuss the logistics of sharing a booth, including the cost split, display setup, and sales process
* Be open to negotiating and finding a mutually beneficial agreement

Here's an example proposal you could use as a starting point:

"Hi [Jewelry Maker's Name],

I hope this message finds you well. I wanted to follow up on our conversation at the seasonal artisan fair and propose an idea for us to collaborate at the upcoming craft fair. I think our handmade candles and soaps would pair perfectly with your beautiful jewelry, and we could attract a lot of customers who are interested in unique, artisanal products.

Would you be interested in sharing a booth with me at the craft fair? We could split the cost of the booth space and electricity, and work together to create a visually appealing display that showcases both of our products. We could also cross-promote each other's products on social media, email newsletters, and our websites.

Let me know if this is something you'd be interested in, and we can discuss the details further. I think it could be a great opportunity for both of us to reach new customers and increase our sales.

Best, [Your Name]"

Remember to be flexible and open to feedback, and I'm sure you'll be able to come to a mutually beneficial agreement. Good luck!
